title: Winnebago profit rises, revenue falls less than expected
text: Winnebago Industries Inc. WGO, +8.07% reported Wednesday fiscal fourth-quarter profit that rose while revenue that fell less than expected, as a beat in motorhome sales helped offset a miss in towable sales. The recreational vehicle maker's stock was still inactive in the premarket. Net income for the quarter to Aug. 31 rose to $31.9 million, or $1.01 a share, from $29.8 million, or 94 cents a share, in the year-ago period. The FactSet consensus for earnings per share was $1.00. Revenue fell 1.1% to $530.4 million, but beat the FactSet consensus of $520.6 million. Towable revenue rose 6.3% to $307.0 million, but missed the FactSet consensus of $313.1 million, while motorhome revenue fell 12.2% to $200.7 million but beat expectations of $187.6 million. "We are especially pleased to deliver record profitability for the Company against the headwinds of ongoing tariffs and higher levels of competitive promotional activity in our target markets," said Chief Executive Michael Happe. The stock has run up 76.5% year to date through Tuesday, while the S&P 500 SPX, +0.15% has advanced 19.5%.
